unnormalised: Booking a hotel in India can feel like an adventure, especially when deciphering the address. I mean, have you ever tried explaining "Opposite the Hanuman Temple, Near the Big Banyan Tree, 2nd Left after the Petrol Pump, Bangalore, 560001" to a foreign friend? They look at you like you've sprouted a second head. GPS? Good luck, bhai! Half the time, Google Maps just drops you in the middle of a cow pasture.

unnormalised: My personal favourite was the time I was trying to find "C/O Sharma Niwas, Behind the SBI Bank, Chandni Chowk, Delhi, 110006." C/O? Care of? Whose care? Was I supposed to ask the chaiwala for Sharma Niwas? The SBI Bank looked like it had been cloned 50 times in a 100-meter radius, each with a slightly different address. Turns out, Sharma Niwas was actually INSIDE the bank manager's office. I kid you not!

unnormalised: And let's not forget the classic "H.No. 12-3-456/A/1, Lane 4, Uppal, Hyderabad, 500039." It sounds like a bloody math equation! I once spent a full hour wandering around Lane 4, convinced I was trapped in a never-ending loop of identical houses. The only way I found the hotel was by bribing an auto-rickshaw driver with a promise of biryani. He knew the exact house, of course. They always do.

unnormalised: Then there was the hotel in Kolkata that claimed to be at "10/2 B, Ballygunge Circular Road, Kolkata, 700019." "B" Ballygunge Circular Road? Was there an "A" Ballygunge Circular Road? And a "C"? The street signs were about as helpful as a chocolate teapot. I eventually resorted to asking a flock of pigeons. They offered surprisingly good directions, albeit punctuated with a lot of cooing.

unnormalised: So, next time you're booking a hotel in India, remember to pack your sense of humor, a good pair of walking shoes, and maybe a bag of birdseed. You'll need them. And always, always, call the hotel directly. Their directions, even if they start with "Near the place where that thing happened in '98," are usually more reliable than any GPS. Good luck, and may the address gods be with you!
